div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1798 Atrek valley, W of Bujnurd (anc. district of Hyrcania), c. 1965 Burial: c. 209 B.C. Contents: c. 1600 AR Alexander III: c. 600 lifetime and early post. dr. 1 post. tetradr. Philip III: 15+ dr. Lysimachus: 5+ dr. Antiochus II: 4+ dr. (Bactra 1+, unc. mints 3+) Arsaces I, Parthia: c. 60 dr. Arsaces II, Parthia: c. 850 dr. Diodotus, Bactria: 1+ dr. Disposition: dispersed Abgarians-Sellwood, NC 1971, pp. 103-119, illus. The attribution of drachms to Arsaces I and II is still doubtful. Some scholars prefer an attribution to Mithradates I, in which case the date of burial must be lowered to c. 150 B.C.
